CHAT.comment: MOT and Chi play well together; EXP stays in the background. Mot and Chi spend most of their time experimenting with the magnets. They discuss how strong the magnets are , they try to find out how close the magnet must be to an object before the object will move toward the magnet , and finally , they get out a children's book which covers science topics in order to see what makes the magnet work. Although Mot asks many of the questions , it is Chi who goes to get the science book without being prompted. Video does not start until later; transcript until then is solely from audio tape

u.a: talks about looking at the essay
MOT and EXP talk about where it is easier for EXP to be

rising
pulls some magnets off black base that Mot is holding and then puts them back on it
picks up blue plastic teddy bear; attempts to stick it to black base; bear falls off black base and slides across the table

picks up arrow and places it on black base

takes the black base from Chi and holds it in the air with the silver circle still suspended from the bottom of it
pulls silver circle off the bottom of the base
sweeps the money , plastic checkered magnets , and the plastic toys all into a pile on the table

holds horseshoe magnet under table and attempts to use it to make the washer move across the top of the table
places a magnet balls in the middle of the washer
puts horseshoe magnet under the table and uses it to make the magnet ball move in circles on the table
places silver ball on the table
moves horseshoe magnet over top of the two balls; they both move
puts horseshoe magnet under table and tries to use it to move the silver ball across the table
places red ball back on table where it rolls around in circles and then sticks to the black base
